newsitem.title: TANZANIA: Tanzania soap manufacturers protest tax increase.
newsitem.headline: Tanzania soap manufacturers protest tax increase.

text.p: Tanzanian soap manufacturers on Tuesday protested a tax increase on crude vegetable oil which they said could damage their business.
The Soap Manufacturers Association of Tanzania (SMAT) complained in a statement about a rise early this month in the import tax on crude vegetable oil to 25 percent from 10 percent.

"The excessive tax policy will definitely kill the soap industry in Tanzania. With such a high tax disadvantage of 70 percent (in Tanzania) versus 30 percent in Kenya, it will be very profitable to import soap," SMAT added.

SMAT said taxes comprised 50 percent of the sale price of soap and the new tax would increase the total to around 70 percent. "Where in the world do they tax such a basic human need so heavily," SMAT said.
SMAT said more than $25 million had been invested in the Tanzanian soap industry in the last five years and the industry directly employed some 2,500 people.
